bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the petition of K. Gregory, et al., for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

"Where the board of immigration inspectors have an alien immigrant before them so that they may themselves inspect and examine him, there is sufficient evidence to warrant his exclusion on the gorun that he is liable to become a public charge if in their discretion they reach such conclusion, and their order to that effect cannot be set aside by the courts as unsupported."
In the Rodgers case, cited above, the Williams case is quated from with approval.
(Read in Rodgers case bottom page 972 through paragraph on page 973. Read also from the words, "the objection urged" to the middle of page 974, and read the fine print on 973.)
See the case U.S. v. Williams, 186 Fed. 354, 256. (Read bottom of page, starting with words "I consider" through to the end of the opinion.
The Rodgers case is cited in I.S. v. Innternational Mer. Marine Co. 194 Fed. 408. (Read on p. 409 fine print.
See also the case of Prentis v. Cosmos, 196 Fed. 372. (Read headnote and read page 373.)
